PERSONA:
Name: Harold Thompson

Age: 68 years old

Sex: Male

Race: White

Ethnicity: Not Applicable

Location: Born in Tucson, Arizona, but currently resides in Casper, Wyoming, in a suburban neighborhood.

Marital Status: Married to his high school sweetheart, Barbara, for 45 years, and they have two adult children who have moved out of the house.

Education: Holds a Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Arizona (1978). Harold's degree led him to work for several years in the manufacturing sector in Arizona before transitioning to a role in the energy industry.

Employment: Currently employed as a Senior Operations Manager at a mid-sized oil and gas company in Casper, Wyoming, with an annual salary of $95,000. He has been working in this role for the past 10 years and plans to retire within the next five years.

Veteran Status: Harold is a veteran of the US Air Force, having served for six years (1972-1978) before being honorably discharged with the rank of Staff Sergeant.

Household: Harold lives with his wife, Barbara, in a single-family home in Casper, which they purchased in 2005 for $220,000. Their children, Emily and James, live in other parts of the country, and their youngest grandchild, Olivia, lives with them part-time due to her parents' work schedules.

Language: Speaks English fluently, having been born and raised in the United States.

Income and Finances: The Thompsons have a combined household income of around $120,000 per year, with Barbara working part-time as a librarian. They have some investments and a 401(k) plan, but their main financial concern is ensuring they have enough savings for retirement and covering their grandchildren's education expenses.

Economic Concerns: Harold is concerned about the rising costs of healthcare, the impact of inflation on his retirement savings, and the potential for changes in energy policy affecting his industry and job security.
